title: Enhance 3D cafe realism with proper furniture and richer in-scene props (Menu coffee cup + more)

requirements.text: Upgrade the main 3D cafe environment so it feels more like an actual cafe by replacing the most placeholder-looking primitive furniture (e.g., simple cylinders/boxes for tables, stools, counter) with more believable cafe furniture geometry and materials, while preserving the existing warm cafe + contour/topographic visual identity.

quotes: Make the cafe more like an actual cafe with proper furniture and add that coffee cup named menu and other things

acceptanceCriteria: In the 3D scene, the counter, tables, and seating read as recognizable cafe furniture (not just basic primitive shapes) via improved geometry detail and/or multi-part meshes and materials.
The upgraded furniture remains consistent with the current warm palette and contour/topographic styling already used in the scene (no jarring art-style mismatch).
The scene still renders without runtime errors and maintains stable frame rate comparable to before (no obvious performance regression from excessive geometry/material complexity).

requirements.text: Improve the in-scene “Menu” coffee cup prop so it looks clearly like a coffee cup placed on/near the counter and is clearly labeled with the exact text "Menu" from normal viewing angles, while keeping existing click/tap behavior to open the Menu panel.

quotes: add that coffee cup named menu

acceptanceCriteria: A 3D coffee-cup-shaped prop is present on/near the counter area in the cafe scene and is visually distinct as a cup (body + handle and coherent material).
The label text is exactly "Menu" and is legible at typical camera distance when approaching the counter.
Clicking/tapping the cup opens the Menu panel; hover/press feedback continues to work.

requirements.text: Add additional cafe “proper furniture and other things” as non-interactive scene dressing (e.g., barista/coffee equipment, display items, decor) placed in sensible cafe locations (counter/back wall/seating area) to make the space feel lived-in, without adding new UI panels or new navigation concepts.
acceptanceCriteria: At least 5 new non-interactive props/furniture pieces are added to the 3D environment (beyond the current counter, tables, stools, shelving, wall art, rug, plant), and they are placed in plausible cafe positions.
New props match the existing lighting and material style and do not visually clip through major surfaces in an obvious way.
No new overlay panels, routes, or backend data models are introduced as part of adding these props.

constraints: Do not edit files in frontend immutablePaths: frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, frontend/src/components/ui.
Backend must remain a single Motoko actor; only add backend changes if strictly required for this request (this request should be achievable frontend-only).
nonGoals: Adding new UI panels beyond the existing Menu/About/Contact/Export panels.
Adding new backend APIs or persistence for furniture/props.
